conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
The board contains ramps of different colors: orange, cyan, green, grey, red, and blue, along with containers labeled E, F, and G at the bottom.
The liquid sources are labeled A, B, C, and D at the top of the board, positioned above the ramps.
Liquid from A hits the long orange ramp near the upper-left and slides rightward.
Liquid from A then hits the long cyan/green ramp in the lower-left and slides right-and-down into container E.
Liquid from B hits the orange ramp slightly farther to the right than A and slides rightward.
Liquid from B then hits the central grey ramp and slides rightward again, past container E, into container F.
Liquid from C hits the upper cyan ramp almost in the middle and slides rightward.
Liquid from C then hits the long red ramp in the bottom-right and slides left-and-down into container F.
Liquid from D hits the upper-right blue ramp and slides rightward to its tip.
Liquid from D then hits the long red ramp and slides left-and-down beyond container F into container G.
The orange ramp on the left half of the board catches anything that drops in on the far left, tilting it to the right.
The lower cyan-green ramp receives whatever falls off the orange ramp at that height and feeds it almost straight down into container E.
Liquid from B lands high on the orange ramp and has enough height to ride the grey ramp as a second stepping-stone, pushing it rightward past container E into container F.
Liquid from C bypasses the grey ramp, reaches the red ramp, and the red ramp tips it leftward into container F.
Liquid from D is already above the blue ramp on the far right, and the first rightward slide plus the second leftward slide on the red ramp drop it beyond container F into container G.
The predicted destinations are A→E, B→F, C→F, D→G.
